snippet: A proposal would require parents to sign a consent form about the risk of herpes transmission when a circumcision procedure includes direct oral contact.
abstract: New York City Board of Health will vote on a proposal requiring parents to sign a consent form indicating they are aware of the risk of herpes transmission when a mohel, or ritual circumciser, uses ancient method that involves direct oral contact with the infant's genitals; city estimates that this particular practice, still commonplace in parts of the ultra-Orthodox Jewish community, has led to 11 babies contracting herpes between 2000 and 2011, and resulted in two deaths.
lead_paragraph: A proposal would require parents to sign a consent form about the risk of herpes transmission when a circumcision procedure includes direct oral contact.

headline.seo: Regulation of Circumcision Method Divides Some Jews
headline.main: Denouncing City’s Move to Regulate Circumcision
headline.print_headline: Denouncing City’s Move To Regulate Circumcision
